Articles.Content:
All right, what with 0.23 coming out next week, I'm not sure if I'll be able to continue Clean Slate. I am retconning the whole thing That is the bad news.

The good news is, I'm letting YOU, the readers, choose my next story! Yes, you get to suggest which great adventure the JSP should take on next! I have a few ideas myself--which I have posted in the poll above--but you can also suggest your own ideas using the form below:

Story Name: What do you think the story should be called? This can be the name of the mission, but it can also be more creative!

Mission: What should the actual mission involve?

Story Length: A short story, or an epic saga? Something in between?

Let your imagination run wild! Just remember, no mods and no Moho.

Story Name: Second Kerbin

Mission: Colonization of Laythe

Story Length: Medium to long. It depends on how much detail you want to have.

(possibly in conjunction with Brianna?)

Edited December 13, 2013 by ElJugador
suggestion

Finishing long stories seems to be difficult for you; shorter ones might be easier to finish.

-A portrait of a Kerbanaut

--Samuel Kerman, who was raised on a farm and despite his father's advice to keep his eyes to the ground upward gazed, yearning to venture the stars

-A detailed mission

--Deafen readers with the roar of SRBs, exhilarate them with the stomach-dropping jolt of decoupling, and awe them with the mighty size of Kerbin

-A comedy of manners at KSC

--A bureaucrat must hide an affair from visitors during a meeting--while his mistress hides under his desk!

-A tragedy on a Laythe base

--A Kerbanaut slowly loses his mind with loneliness. Just before he kills himself, he cries for help via radio, and due to the great distance, the life-saving reply is too late.

-Duxwing

Finishing long stories seems to be difficult for you; shorter ones might be easier to finish.

-A portrait of a Kerbanaut

--Samuel Kerman, who was raised on a farm and despite his father's advice to keep his eyes to the ground upward gazed, yearning to venture the stars

-A detailed mission

--Deafen readers with the roar of SRBs, exhilarate them with the stomach-dropping jolt of decoupling, and awe them with the mighty size of Kerbin

-A comedy of manners at KSC

--A bureaucrat must hide an affair from visitors during a meeting--while his mistress hides under his desk!

-A tragedy on a Laythe base

--A Kerbanaut slowly loses his mind with loneliness. Just before he kills himself, he cries for help via radio, and due to the great distance, the life-saving reply is too late.

-Duxwing

Good advice, Dux! Mostly, the reason I fail to complete longer tales is because I keep forgetting to update! Choosing tasks above my difficulty level is another biggie.
I like the Eve base idea. I think it would offer quite a story; a long-term space mission can offer a view point on some of the choices in life.

I like the Eve base idea. I think it would offer quite a story; a long-term space mission can offer a view point on some of the choices in life.

Nice, I like the idea of a philosophical story.

what about me

I like that idea, too. Laythe is the most interesting place in the solar system, and I would love to set up a base there one day.
Come on, only three days to go!
Last day, get your votes and ideas in now!
And that's it! Looks like I'm heading to Dres! Thanks for voting, and enjoy 0.23!

And that's it! Looks like I'm heading to Dres! Thanks for voting, and enjoy 0.23!

I'm headed there myself! Good luck with your story, can't wait to read
